name: Courtyard by Marriott Washington DC \ Dupont Circle

reviews.text: Hotel is very nice, however I did find the rooms very small. Did ask for a room change due to face a wall in the first room. Second room had nice views. Very convenient location, many nice restaurants in the area, Metro very close.
reviews.title: Nice Views

reviews.text: 4 day stay for business. Hotel staff could not have been nicer or more helpful. Hotel room was very small, one very uncomfortable chair and a desk chair to sit on. Stains in the carpeting. Bathroom was very clean.
reviews.title: Courtyard by Marriott Washington DC

reviews.text: once I stopped going around and around the block trying to figure out how to get the hotel, I was warmly greeted by the front desk staff who were pleasant and friendly every time i was in the lobby. the valet parking was so honest- they turned in $60 cash that my friend left on the floor of the vehicle! the room was spotless, one of the cleanest I have ever stayed in. The restaurant and lobby food options were more than I expected.
reviews.title: excellent staff and very clean hotel

reviews.text: Other than the issues with the GPS, this was an excellent place to stay
reviews.title: Great views, good location, a little basic but decent

reviews.text: Courtyards generally offer a no-frills experience, and this is no exception: the restaurant is very basic, though they will give you a decent latte. But it's in a great location, a few minutes' walk from Dupont metro and its shops and restaurants, clean, with good staff, and if you get a room facing down Conn. Ave, fabulous views. The fitness room only has CV equipment.
reviews.title: Average is the word that fits to this hotel, no more no less...

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel for a couple nights on business and really enjoyed it. The hotel itself is a few blocks from Dupont Circle and the Metro station there. It was a bit of a hassle walking with luggage, but totally fine without luggage - about a 5-10 minute walk to the Metro depending on how long you have to wait at the traffic lights. There are a lot of shops and restaurants between the hotel and Dupont Circle, which is nice. I was travelling alone and really enjoy this area in general due to the good street scene and foot traffic well into the evening. I never feel funny about walking back to my hotel at night.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself was great - clean, comfortable, well-maintained. My room was well-furnished with a comfortable mattress, good linens, and a nice work area. WiFi was very strong and never dropped off. The only downside of my room was that there wasn't much counter space in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Nice property, good rates

reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Great Location, nice rooms, fine staff!

reviews.text: I do wish that the pool was open longer - it is seasonal and closed the weekend before my stay.
reviews.title: Decent hotel, friendly staff

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel while on a business trip and was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The front desk and staff was very helpful and pleasant. There is an onsite restaurant in which the food was decent. The location is good and there are many eating places within walking distance. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: A Real Gem

reviews.text: The rooms are adequate and very clean. The location is excellent. The best part of the stay was the staff. The front desk staff were some of the friendliest, most helpful staff I've encountered. They made us feel that we were their guests and anticipated our needs. I agree with Wexford3: Marriott needs to recognize what outstanding employees they have in this hotel.
reviews.title: Good location and exceptional staff.

reviews.text: I was very impressed with the room, amenities and staff of this hotel. The location was in walking distance of Starbuck's, Metro transportation, and restaurants. The room was clean. Breakfast variety was nice and the staff was very helpful and friendly. I'd highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great location, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Overall:
reviews.title: Great location and service, basic amenities
Amazing
reviews.text: The hotel is basic, but the location is GREAT and we would definitely stay there again. Everyone there was very nice, highly accommodating, and friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is located in Dupont Circle and is surrounded by many shops and restaurants. The Metro is about 5-10 minute walk (and then downtown DC/National Mall about 5 minutes away on Metro). Service was great. The rooms are basic - very clean with comfortable beds, and a basic bath. There is a bistro on the first floor that serves a limited menu and some alcoholic beverages. The simple food was nicely prepared. There are set hours for breakfast, lunch, & dinner. Starbucks coffee is served all day. There is a small shop near the front desk where you can purchase snacks, drinks, and limited sundries. Parking is about $30 per day and the valet service required very little waiting. The gym has about three or four treadmills, an elliptical machine, and free weights. The treadmills have individual tvs and ipod ports. It was clean and empty - hopped on treadmill. There is a terrace pool that we didn't use, but it looked nice (decent size, clean, nice chairs surrounding) and at one point my son noticed a lifeguard serving quesadillas to the patrons.
reviews.title: Very Pleasant

reviews.text: The room is clean and the bed is comfy. The location is perfect that i spent 2-3 mins walk to white house and jefferson place. Also a short walk to restaurants area. I didn't get to use a lot of hotels facilities but overall, stayig at mariott was a pleasant stay
reviews.title: Right in the center

reviews.text: although this hotel is foot steps away from the metro station it is a pretty plain jane hotel. That being said, it was clean and the staff was pleasant. I've just come to expect more from the Marriott brand.
reviews.title: not the best

reviews.text: But this was a great location if you were riding the metro as you didn't need a car to get anywhere. There is a 7-11 a few steps away too. Overall would sty there again as you leave Regan airport hop the metro and you are there for $3-$4..went all over dc on the metro had a great time.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in July this year and they went over backwards with great customer service. We liked the location close to the underground and down town DC. The rooms were large, clean and had every ting you need, I would recommend, this hotel.
reviews.title: really liked it!

reviews.text: it's a nice hotel. good rooms, and bathrooms. clean hotel and linen. Noise levels of ac is low and sleep quality is good. the terrace is a nice place for having a coffee or meal, swimming pool looked nice, but did not get time to check it out.
reviews.title: Great Customer Service and Location

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Washington Dc Dupont Circle Hotel
